node.doctext:
CST review archive 13

This is a storage node for CST reviews. Contents are moved her from [CST_Chat].

This archive begins on 8/10/04, When it's full we'll move to [CST_Storage_14].

See also Quest Storage collabs [CST_Storage_1|1], [CST_Storage_2|2], [CST_Storage_3|3], [CST_Storage_4|4], [CST_Storage_5|5], [CST_Storage_6|6], [CST_Storage_7|7], [CST_Storage_8|8], [CST_Storage_9|9], [CST_Storage_10|10], [CST_Storage_11|11], [CST_Storage_12|12], [CST_Storage_13|13], [CST_Storage_14|14].

08/10/04 Batch processed by gom
Writeup Title: The penis mightier than the sword

Original Author's Permission received?: N
Quoted content less than 33%: n
Compliance Assessment: No

Hi there, Bad news I'm afraid. This writeup doesn't appear to be compliant with the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material|E2 Copyright Policy] and is being removed. If you'd like to update and repost, please /msg [gom|me]. Sorry.

Writeup Title:[Insulting Beauty, you misspend]
Author: [BlackPawn]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 3%
Compliance Assessment: Yes.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2004.7.4@17:37 [BlackPawn] says Hi, I noded some PD [Insulting Beauty, you misspend|poetry] and wonder if the publication I took it from would have copyright over the layout, possible spelling corrections etc.
Hello BlackPawn, To answer your question submitted to [Content_Salvage] about the publication holding copyright on the layout and spelling the answer to your question is yes. Fortunately there is enough original content added by you to be compliant as fair use as defined in the [E2 copyright changes]. Yay! If you would like to you may append the following link, [CST Approved] .

If you would like a [CST Approved] tag you will have to rewrite it and get [smileloki] to go over it to resubmit it to [Content_Salvage].

Writeup Title: [Nobody likes me, everybody hates me, think I'll go eat worms]
Author:[icicle] [flamingweasel] [Tem42]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: Yes.
Original Author's Permission received?: N/A
Quoted content less than 33%: N/A
Compliance Assessment: Yes.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:

2004.6.23@8:34 [GrouchyOldMan] says [Nobody likes me, everybody hates me, think I'll go eat worms] Hmmmmm.
Hello [GrouchyOldMan] [Nobody likes me, everybody hates me, think I'll go eat worms] is a traditional camp fire song. After a diligent search on the net I can find no author claiming to have written it. Worms are full of protein ! Itsy, bitsy, fuzzy, wuzzy worms.yum yum :)

Writeup Title:[ i sing of Olaf glad and big]
Author:[Eidolos]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?:No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 14%, update-14%
Compliance Assessment: Yes.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:2004.6.16@0:42 Eidolos says Please review i sing of Olaf glad and big for copyright compliance. I'm fairly sure it passes but I want to be absolutely sure.
Hello Eidolos, Your w/u i sing of Olaf glad and big has been reviewed by the CST_Group and is compliant. Please append this hardlink [CST Approved]. Thank you:)
Update:2005.1.25@8:24 [Eidolos] says Hullo. I made some simple formatting improvements to [i sing of Olaf glad and big] and would like to be re-approved. Thanks much for your work.
Hello [Eidolos], [i sing of Olaf glad and big] has been reviewed and updated. As it stands today, January 28, 2005, the poem is 14% of the entire write up putting well within the guidelines from [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material]. [Content_Salvage] is a group that takes a look at write ups to determine copyright compliance. I did view the formatting through IE 6.0 and Firefox and the formatting looks first rate! If you have anymore concerns about formatting [avalyn] might be a good [the power structure of everything2|editor] to ask:)
Note: Original evaluation can be found in [CST_Storage_13]

Writeup Title:[Breaking The Girl]
Author:[jam-master jim]
Reviewer: [GrouchyOldMan]
Public domain?: N
Original Author's Permission received?: N
Quoted content less than 33%: Y
Compliance Assessment: Y
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2004.10.9 (55.5 min) [dannye] says What about [Breaking The Girl]? I have nuked a lot of "tab" entries here in the past, but I'm not sure how they fit in w/ the new policy.
Hi there. [CST_Group|We've] been asked to review this wu for copyright compliance and I'm wondering if you created the impressive tablature yourself or from a published book?
jam-master jim says Hi, I made the tab listening to the cd and watching live shows. I've had a look at other tabs on the internet and obviously there are similarities, but none are the same. In fact none have the two guitar parts at all. The only thing I have qualms with is putting the lyrics on the w/u - that could be a problem, but easily fixed!
you said "Posting the lyrics is probably cool under fair use as long as the tab is your original work. I'll do the review and let you know..." to jam-master jim (sent to 1 noder)
Congrats, this wu is copyright compliant under fair use and you can add the [CST Approved] link if you want. Cheers.
NOTE: Tablature counted as original content per the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material|E2 Copyright Policy].
Tc = 2291 , Tq =104 , %q= 4.5%

GrouchyOldMan says re John Cleese remembers Graham Chapman : I reckon you've got two paths to choose from: either source it as a transcript of the publicly presented speech( public domain ) and remove the citation, or keep the Johnson citation and add enough original text so that the quote is less than 1/3 of the original material ( fair use ). I'd feel more comfortable reviewing it under fair use, but I'll let you decide.
Roninspoon says I'm going to add more to it, but not for a few days probably. I'm busy like a mofo. I can at least remove the book citation,a s that wasn't my source anyway.
